lead_paragraph: Jerry Yang, a 39-year-old psychologist, won the top prize of $8.25 million at the World Series of Poker yesterday in Las Vegas. He vaulted from eighth to the chip lead soon after play began Tuesday afternoon. He knocked out seven of the eight other players at the final table.Yang, who began playing poker two years ago, aggressively raised pots and became the first player at the table to go all-in. On the ninth hand, he forced Lee Childs, a 35-year-old software engineer, to fold pocket queens, face up, on a board with a seven, a four and a deuce.Nine players who began the day were all that remained from a field of 6,358 that began to play down in stages July 6. Everyone paid or won $10,000 to enter the main event, the biggest poker tournament of the year.
